title: Dodger should be locked in their autofill position for a short period of time.
body: If people dodge, they should be locked their role for a short period of time.  I feel slightly tilted whenever I got a role I queue up for, but then after a few Champ Select I got kicked into a role I did not queue for. I am fine if the system Autofills me, but it does not feel that great playing a role I are not comfortable with. (Bot Lane)

replies.body: Yeah, so people can go from dodging to inting. That'd be great.

> [{quoted}](name=Big Lincoln,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=1OM7fuz9,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2017-01-05T01:25:17.971+0000)
>
> Yeah, so people can go from dodging to inting. That'd be great.

They'd get banned really fast. It always makes me happy to see someone justifiably banned and this would eventually make matches have generally higher quality and shorter queue times.

Dodging isn't a problem. If someone doesn't want to play what they got forced into and nobody's willing to trade, they have every right to dodge the game and accept the queue penalty.

It'd lower the quality of games, if anything. I don't need someone who's forced into a role after dodging to avoid that role in the first place and then playing on tilt.
They already get punished. Get good at all roles, dont QQ about others.

I do feel like this is a good idea, even if you may have the wrong motivations. Many dodgers dodge because they don't get the position they want, and this would be a kind of righteous justice. Additionally, there does seem to be a problem with Autofill right now, and having the dodgers autofill would fill this gap.

Either this or put them in a separate queue where they're stuck with other people who would rather dodge and extend everyone's queue time instead of just playing the game in their not-favorite position.

It would make me feel a lot happier to know that when I auto-fill it's with other players who aren't jerks.
